title: Blackbody - select blackbody spectrum vs lambda

content.question: Which of the following graphs best represents <math alttext="I of lambda" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>λ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, the intensity per unit wavelength of radiation emitted by a blackbody, as a function of the wavelength <math alttext="lambda" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>λ</mi></math>?

choices.label: The figure shows a graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “lambda.” The vertical axis is labeled “I of lambda.” The line begins at the origin, moves upward and to the right, and ends high above the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “lambda.” The vertical axis is labeled “I of lambda.” The curve begins at the origin, horizontal and to the right at first, then increases gradually at first, then more steeeply, and ends high above the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “lambda.” The vertical axis is labeled “I of lambda.” The curve begins slightly to the right of the vertical axis and high above the horizontal axis, moves downward and to the right, steeply at first and then more gradually, and ends slightly above the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “lambda.” The vertical axis is labeled “I of lambda.” The curve begins at the origin, moves horizontally to the right along the horizontal axis for approximately one eighth the length of the axis, then moves steeply upward and to the right, reaching its maximum high above the horizontal axis approximately one fourth of the way along the axis. It then moves downward and to right, steeply at first and then more gradually, and ends slightly above the end of the horizontal axis.
